> [neuroticfish](#comment_10_1KUV6GoC4BTwnDeWEGbrYbgJ84G6AG3s7N): Depending on what level you want to reach (CEFR) and which disciplines (ie. good at reading, bad at speaking) there are different methodologies. [...]

Yeah, I think ultimately I'll need to live in Russia for a while to get a thorough understanding of the language.

> [driud](#comment_205_18yZKKFySP5bvmNy14T9vgj3H99AC1PQkH): simple reliable method of learning a foreign language.You take the newspaper, and you read it aloud.You take the movie, turn on the subtitles, and read it aloud.After a month, you will understand half the movie and after two you will understand almost the entire movie. These are supposed to be normal movies, from everyday life.How will you start to understand? Then you can try to learn to write.It works 100%.As for the Russian language, first you have to learn the letters, then read them.

I really do need to write more to get my reps up.
